metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6160 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
tcprewrite in tcpreplay before 4.1.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a large frame, a related issue to CVE-2017-14266.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpreplay - 3.4.4-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpreplay package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.4-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
